Jim Edlin's Website
Résumé

Jim Edlin
Résumé

Overview

User experience designer and full-stack web developer with deep experience in dynamic web application design and development (JS/Node and LAMP stacks).

Experience

Kiva.org
Senior Web Developer
February 2011 - present

Member of engineering team developing and maintaining high volume e-commerce marketplace site for microlending. Helped evolve site from desktop-only LAMP architecture to responsive design with client-side Backbone/Marionette SPA accessing HATEOS (Siren) API endpoints. Also participated in UI/UX design, product planning and user research.

Chug.net
Web Developer
August 2010 - December, 2010

Member of development team for Chug.net vertical automotive search engine startup. Primarily did javascript/jQuery front end development. (Site UI was almost 100% javascript, making AJAX calls for content served as JSON.) Extensive use of jQuery plug-ins for dynamic graphs, filtering, sorting, and other user interactions.

Arizona Bay
Architect/Developer (contract)
May 2010 - July, 2010

Maintained and enhanced e-commerce AJAX website and back end systems for SmartRoam.net (now Chattimeapp.com), a Singapore telecom company offering VOIP-based local phone numbers in 57 countries that redirect to any other number of a customer's choice. Development in PHP5 with CodeIgniter framework and MySQL.

The2ofYou.com
Cofounder, CTO
March, 2009 - May, 2010

Sole technical co-founder of startup developing a “counseling and relationship-strengthening” website for couples. (Concept: “Match.com helps you get together; The2ofYou.com helps you stay together.”) Led site design, development and testing, managed infrastructure, managed offshore contract developers. Site was heavily AJAX, using Railo, Prototype/Scriptaculous, MySQL. Also, together with three other cofounders, collaborated in all the myriad activities involved in launching a startup.

 

Arizona Bay
Architect/Developer (contract)
2008 - 2009

Designed, developed and launched enhancements and updates to high-volume transactional web e-commerce system for JumpStart Automotive Media. Created consumer-facing AJAX car-selection configurator in MVC environment using Coldfuson MX7, MySQL, Javascript/Prototype and a bit of Java. Also created back-end AJAX management tool for this configurator, allowing extensive customization of appearance and operation by each of client's customers. Implemented framework for SOAP web service transactions between client's system and systems of client's B2B customers.

 

 

Tides.org
Business Applications Architect
2003 - 2008

Tides.org
Technologist-in-Residence
1998 - 2003

Led numerous projects to define, choose, adopt, design and implement technology solutions for this network of nonprofit organizations (including Tides Foundation, Tides Center, Tides Shared Spaces, and others) to support its mission of"actively promoting change toward a healthy and just society." Acted as CTO for development and launch of eGrants internet donation-processing system (now merged into NetworkForGood.org). Also developed other e-commerce sites. Led design and development of extranets for Tides Foundation donors and Tides Center projects, including online reports derived from financial systems-of-record.
